Securities - fungible, negotiable financial instruments representing financial value
Debt - risk-free securities, such as bonds, commercial notes, and bank deposits
Equity - refers to companies stocks or share value
Derivatives - value depon on the values of other, more basic underlying variables. e.g. futures, swaps, and options

Bonds are usually considered the benchmark of risk-free security in financial engineering
